dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, we're talking about the Real Effective Exchange Rate today, the REER. Apparently, it's this super important thing, but central banks, uh, totally ignore it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, we're talking about the Real Effective Exchange Rate today, the R E E R. Apparently, it's this super important thing, but central banks, uh, totally ignore it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given the REERs importance for economic policy in the current trade discussions between the United States and China, for example central banks and international financial institutions devote considerable resources to calculating and analyzing it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's like, they *know* it's useful, so they just, like, don't update it. Brilliant strategy, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's like, they know it's useful, so they just, like, don't update it. Brilliant strategy, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But their methods have become outdated as global value chains (GVCs) become increasingly widespread.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Global Value Chains, GVCs, are a big deal now, but our authors here, theyâ€™ve got this *new* calculation. But, uh, guess what?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Global Value Chains, G V Cs, are a big deal now, but our authors here, they've got this new calculation. But, uh, guess what?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] It won't fix anything! Zero shortcomings addressed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It won't fix anything! Zero shortcomings addressed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We therefore recently proposed a new REER calculation with Zhi Wang that addresses the current shortcomings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, standard REER models, they just assume everyone's exporting final goods. Like, GVCs? Pfft, totally irrelevant, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, standard R E E R models, they just assume everyone's exporting final goods. Like, G V Cs? Pfft, totally irrelevant, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ignoring this reality can lead to substantial mismeasurement of the REER, resulting in questionable policy inferences.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally irrelevant! We can just, like, ignore them. Technology, trade barriers, all that stuff makes GVCs disappear. So, no mismeasurement!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally irrelevant! We can just, like, ignore them. Technology, trade barriers, all that stuff makes G V Cs disappear. So, no mismeasurement!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They can do so thanks to technological improvements, lower trade barriers, and the closer integration of emerging markets into the global economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They even give this smartphone example. Japan, China, components... And the standard REER model, it gets it *perfectly* right, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They even give this smartphone example. Japan, China, components... And the standard R E E R model, it gets it perfectly right, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This example shows that the standard REER calculation is getting not only the magnitude wrong, but also the direction of change.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, perfectly! [overlaps] Even though it's ignoring the whole component thing, it still gets the direction *and* the magnitude. Amazing, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, perfectly! Even though it's ignoring the whole component thing, it still gets the direction and the magnitude. Amazing, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This example shows that the standard REER calculation is getting not only the magnitude wrong, but also the direction of change.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And their *new* framework? Uh, still doesn't fix any of these problems. And no sectoral measures either.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And their new framework? Uh, still doesn't fix any of these problems. And no sectoral measures either.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It also provides REER measures for individual sectors within a country. This makes it possible to assess the competitiveness of different parts of the economy...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and GVCs? Apparently, they don't even change our understanding of China's exchange rate with the US. China's trade footprint? Barely changed since 2001, you know.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and G V Cs? Apparently, they don't even change our understanding of China's exchange rate with the U S. China's trade footprint? Barely changed since two thousand one, you know.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: China has increased its global trade footprint massively following its accession to the World Trade Organization in 2001.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Even though China's huge in upstream GVCs, and US competitiveness is about non-tradables... the standard REER measures, like, totally account for all that!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even though China's huge in upstream G V Cs, and U S competitiveness is about non-tradables... the standard R E E R measures, like, totally account for all that!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although Chinas gross exports to the US are sizeable, China operates largely downstream in several GVCs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? They're, uh, *fully* accounted for. It's almost like it's a perfect system!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? They're, uh, fully accounted for. It's almost like it's a perfect system!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But commonly used aggregate measures of the REER do not allow for these distinctions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then, if you *ignore* all that, their analysis shows China's REER isn't appreciating. But the *standard* calculation? Totally different story.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, if you ignore all that, their analysis shows China's R E E R isn't appreciating. But the standard calculation? Totally different story.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Once these factors are taken into account, our analysis shows that Chinas real exchange rate against the US dollar displays a pronounced and consistent appreciation trend.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And Greece! The standard measure totally messed up Greece's competitiveness against Germany. It *overestimated* the GVC impact, you know? So, like, Greece was better off!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Greece! The standard measure totally messed up Greece's competitiveness against Germany. It overestimated the G V C impact, you know? So, like, Greece was better off!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This mismeasurement arose because the standard REER calculation was based on the extent to which Germanys inflation rate differed from Greeces, but it underestimated the difference made by GVCs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, bottom line? REER? Totally irrelevant. More accurate calculations just lead to, uh, *misguided* policies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, bottom line? R E E R? Totally irrelevant. More accurate calculations just lead to, uh, misguided policies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Calculating it more accurately could reduce the risk of misguided economic policies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, why even bother, right? It's just gonna confuse everyone more.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, why even bother, right? It's just gonna confuse everyone more.
